cab.content: SB' C RET.W.P.(.45) 106., ijLTH MARCH * 1943,. COPY NO, V3WAR -CABINET.DEMANDS ON SHIPPING RESULTING FROM' . .OVERSEAS CEREAL REQUIREMENTS.Note by the Prime MinisterB(See W.P.. (43) 63)I am glad to learn from the Minister ofWar Transport that a strict line is being takenin dealing with requests for cereals from theIndian Ocean areas a concession to one country at once encourages demands from all the others^The small amounts asked for representnegligible additions to the crops in thosecountries. They must learn to look after them-selves as we have done. The grave situation ofthe U.K. Import programme imperils the whole war-effort and we cannot afford to send ships merely as a gesture of good willBW.SoC.10a. Downing Street, S:.VvVl*10th March,. 1943,DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY1S GOVERNMENT)
